title: Hilton Los Cabos Beach & Golf Resort Remembers Hurricane Odile One Year Later
text:
Thumbnail September 10, 2015 09:25 AM   
LOS CABOS, Mexico & MCLEAN, Va.- Leading up to the one-year anniversary of Hurricane Odile, one of the most powerful hurricanes to ever strike the Baja California Peninsula in Mexico, Hilton Los Cabos Beach & Golf Resort is celebrating a new beginning. Following a year of recovery and renovation, today the hotel will recognize team members and welcome back guests for a reunion during which a short film commemorating the incredible restoration journey will be debuted. Hilton will also be broadcasting the event and other happenings on-property via a live video stream throughout the day. 
“What our team members did during Hurricane Odile – putting our guests first above everything – is something we’ll never forget at Hilton,” said Rob Palleschi, global head, full service brands, Hilton Worldwide. “Their resilience and winning spirit carried us through the storm and today we’re celebrating that our team is back in action making Hilton Los Cabos Beach & Golf Resort even better than it was before.” 
Thanks to the overwhelming generosity of team members across Hilton Worldwide, guests and the public, Hilton Los Cabos Beach & Golf Resort team members were supported with basic needs to rebuild their homes and communities through the Hilton Worldwide Responds Fund which provided more than $500,000 in financial aid as well as in-kind donations and supplies: More than 12,000 bottles and gallons of drinking water were delivered to team members, guests and surrounding hotels Two months of basic groceries were provided to more than 500 people Thirty-six team member homes were rebuilt Every one of the more than 350 team members kept their jobs and many were reskilled to help with the property rebuild, the second phase of which will be completed this month Guests donated hundreds of toys for team members’ children as well as 150 suitcases of clothing Team members with chronic illnesses were provided ongoing medical care Dozens of team members’ children were cared for in a day care created in the hotel ballroom 
“Hilton Los Cabos Beach & Golf Resort has been a jewel in the Hilton portfolio since it first opened more than a decade ago,” said Tom Potter, senior vice president, operations, Latin America & Caribbean, Hilton Worldwide. “The team’s dedication throughout the rebuilding process has shown us the true meaning of spreading the light and warmth of hospitality and we’re thrilled to be welcoming guests back once again to experience the breathtaking beauty of Los Cabos, Mexico.” 
To learn more about Hilton Los Cabos Beach & Golf Resort’s restoration journey or to tune into the anniversary celebration, follow Hilton Hotels & Resorts on Facebook ( https://www.facebook.com/hilton ), Instagram ( @hiltonhotels ) and Twitter ( @hiltonhotels ). Live video streaming will begin via Periscope (@hiltonhotels), Meerkat (@hiltonhotels) and MyEye (@hiltonhotels) today with a stunning sunrise over the Sea of Cortez and take viewers on a virtual tour of a day in the life of a guest at the spectacularly renovated Hilton Los Cabos Beach & Golf Resort. Additionally, Hilton Hotels & Resorts has launched Resetting the Stage in Los Cabos , an interactive Instagram adventure showcasing key moments throughout the restoration journey. 
For additional information or to book a reservation at Hilton Los Cabos Beach & Golf Resort, please visit www.loscabos.hilton.com or call 1-800-HILTONS (445-8667). About Hilton Los Cabos Beach & Resort 
Ideally set along the destination's most tranquil stretch of golden beach, the AAA four-diamond award-winning Hilton Los Cabos Beach & Golf Resort boasts 375 spacious and elegantly designed ocean‐view guestrooms with private balconies including its new Hotel within a Hotel concept La Vista Club Rooms and Vista Club Lounge. All rooms feature high‐speed wireless Internet access, mini‐bar, in‐room safe and LCD television. Seven dining outlets and 24‐hour room service make choice seem limitless. Recreation options include a TechnoGym® and PRECOR® fitness center, movement studio, two lit tennis courts, two pools with swim‐up bars, a Jacuzzi and a pool concierge available to provide iPods, books, games and fun treats. Hilton Los Cabos also features one of the only swimmer-friendly beaches on the tourist corridor, as well as an all-new 7,000-square-foot spa and salon set to open in September 2015. Children ages four to 12 can enjoy the resort's Cabo Kids Camp featuring age‐specific activities, arts and crafts, games and a professional staff. For more information, www.hiltonloscabos.com .
